clinical_study.brief_title: Mental Imagery Tasks to Reduce Internet Gaming Disorder (IGD) Cravings
clinical_study.official_title: Mental Imagery Tasks to Reduce IGD Cravings: Visual Imagery and Auditory Imagery

brief_summary.textblock: To test whether visual and auditory imagery tasks can effectively reduce the craving for IGD.

detailed_description.textblock: This project is to use imagery tasks to reduce the craving of internet gamers. To test whether visual and auditory imagery tasks can effectively reduce the craving for IGD. This project will be conducted in Beijing, China, based on a large sample of internet gamers.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 0-1 minutes before each set of cue
primary_outcome.description: The craving of internet gamers is measured by a single item Visual Analogue Scale with 1 to 7 likert score

primary_outcome.measure: The craving of internet gamers after cue
primary_outcome.description: The craving of internet gamers is measured by a single item Visual Analogue Scale with 1 to 7 likert scoreScale with 1 to 7 likert score

primary_outcome.time_frame: 0-1 minutes after finishing each block of tasks
primary_outcome.description: The craving of internet gamers is measured by a single item Visual Analogue Scale with 1 to 7 likert score

arm_group.description: During the intervention, each participant of this group will be asked to create visual mental images.
During the intervention, each participant of this group will be asked to create auditory mental images.

intervention.description: All participants need to finish both visual imagery tasks and auditory imagery tasks. Visual imagery tasks and auditory imagery tasks will be carried out at intervals to avoid the influence of different tasks. The sequence of imagery tasks will be counterbalanced across participants.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- The scores of the 9 items of The Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, Fifth Edition(DSM-5) recommended diagnosis for Internet gaming disorder ≥ 5.
- Engagement in popular Internet games (e.g. Arena of Valor, League of Legends and Player Unknown's Battle Grounds) for over 20 hours per week for a minimum of 12 months.
- The scores of the Young-Internet Addiction Test(Y-IAT) ≥ 50
Exclusion Criteria:
- Current or history of use of illegal substances and gambling;
- Current or history of psychiatric or neurological illness;
- Current use of psychotropic medications.
